wikipedia_page.main: Captain Ronald Frank Strickland Mauduit   (30 October 1895 – 13 March 1928) was a British cavalry officer and First World War flying ace credited with nine aerial victories.

response: * Ronald Mauduit (1895–1928), British World War I flying ace

link_mentions.page: List of World War I aces credited with 9 victories

response: In 1917 Mason was a Corporal in the Royal Flying Corps, serving as an observer/gunner in No. 11 Squadron, flying the Bristol F.2b two-seater fighter. His first aerial victory came on 8 June, with Captain Richard Raymond-Barker as his pilot, when he drove down out of control an Albatros D.III over Bohain. On 14 August he drove down an Albatros D.V over Brebières, and on 21 October accounted for three D.Vs over Boiry–Lécluse, with pilot Lieutenant Ronald Mauduit on both occasions.
